name: Uterine Arteriovenous Malformation (AVM) with Secondary Hemorrhagic Shock
chief_complaint: Severe pelvic pain and heavy vaginal bleeding for 12 hours
prognosis: Guarded - depends on rapid intervention. 30% mortality if hemorrhagic shock progresses to DIC
description: A rare vascular anomaly where abnormal connections form between uterine arteries and veins, causing high-flow shunting. Most cases occur after uterine trauma (D&C, C-section, or miscarriage). Can lead to life-threatening hemorrhage due to the high-pressure arterial flow into low-resistance venous system.
multiple_choice: Uterine Arteriovenous Malformation (AVM) with Secondary Hemorrhagic Shock
